Name: Babka
Description: Cinnamon and chopped nuts or Chocolate swirled into a challah ( egg ) bread/cake

Name: Bagel
Description: Circle of boiled and baked yeast bread

Name: Bialy
Description: Similar to the bagel , but without the hole , filled with onions and other ingredients before baking

Name: Borscht
Description: Beetroot soup , usually served with sour cream

Name: Blintz
Description: Thin egg pancake wrapped around a sweet mixture of farmer 's cheese , potato , or fruit pie filling , similar to a crÃªpe , but with the ends tucked in and fried again in butter ; often served with sour cream

Name: Brisket
Description: Braised meat from the chest area of a cow

Name: Bublitchki
Description: Mini hard bagel -shaped sweet breads , commonly eaten with tea or coffee

Name: Challah
Description: Braided egg bread

Name: Charoset
Description: Apple and nut dish generally served at Passover

Name: Chicken soup
Description: A traditional soup for the Sabbath evening dinner , usually spiced with parsley and/or dill , and served with kneidlach or kreplach and vegetables

Name: Cholent/Chamin
Description: A slow-cooked stew of meat , potatoes , beans and barley often served on the Sabbath

Name: Chopped liver
Description: Chopped or minced roasted beef or chicken liver , mixed with hard boiled eggs , onions , and spices

Name: Chrain
Description: Pickled chopped horseradish , sometimes with beets

Name: Eyerlekh
Description: Unhatched eggs found inside just-slaughtered chickens , typically cooked in soup

Name: Farfel
Description: Small pellet-shaped egg pasta . A Passover version made from matzo is called matzo farfel

Name: Gedempte Fleisch
Description: Ashkenazic pot roast , traditionally made with beef , various vegetables , tomato paste , and spices

Name: Gefilte fish
Description: Originally a stuffed fish , filled with a mixture of chopped fish , eggs , onions , matzo meal or crumbs , and spices . Nowadays , it usually refers to poached fish cakes or a fish loaf , sometimes made with matzo meal

Name: Goulash
Description: Spicy meat stew

Name: Gribenes
Description: Chicken or goose skin cracklings with fried onions , a kosher food somewhat similar to pork rinds . A byproduct of the preparation of schmaltz by rendering chicken or goose fat

Name: Hamantashen
Description: Triangular pastry filled with poppy seed or prune paste , or fruit jams , eaten during Purim
